TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit GeneratedCodeAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies code generated by a tool. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GeneratedCodeAttribute class can be used by code analysis tools to identify computer-generated code, and to provide an analysis based on the tool and the version of the tool that generated the code.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the GeneratedCodeAttribute class to identify computer-generated code.
[!code-cpp[System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCodeAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.codedom.compile_3_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCodeAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.codedom.compile_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratedCodeAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.codedom.compile_3_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string tool, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the tool that generated the code.
The version of the tool that generated the code.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class specifying the name and version of the tool that generated the code.
Gets the name of the tool that generated the code.
Docs.value: The name of the tool that generated to code.

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the tool that generated the code.
Docs.value: The version of the tool that generated the code.
